steps.title: Landing on the application
details: Every test was able to reach https://invoify.vercel.app without issue.
Basic header ("BETA English Toggle theme") and primary buttons generally rendered.

steps.title: Invoice creation – “Bill From / Bill To” (Step 1)
details: Both tests looking for the “Bill From :” and “Bill To :” headers timed-out (5 s) – locator could not find the h4 elements.
Subsequent form-fill, validation, and data-persistence steps were never executed.

steps.title: Template system – choosing template & uploading logo
details: UI failed to expose expected template names (“Template 1 / Template 2”) or the logo-upload control.
Live preview header could not be located → tests aborted before verifying preview refresh.

steps.title: Live preview – real-time update & wizard sync
details: Initial data entry reflected in preview (pass), but later edits did NOT propagate – validation failed after several retries.
Another test could not click the step button labelled “1 . From & To”, suggesting wizard buttons are off-screen or mislabeled.

steps.title: Signature system – draw, type & upload
details: Canvas element (‘<canvas>’) never became visible within 20 s.
Typed-signature and image-upload sections were not found; tests aborted early.

steps.title: Financial calculations – line items, tax, discount, shipping
details: Sections labelled “3 . Line Items” and “Tax Calculation” were not detected; therefore auto-calculation logic was never exercised.
Discount/shipping test could not even find default subtotal fields (“Subtotal: 0.00 USD”).

steps.title: Export & distribution – PDF, email, JSON/CSV/XML
details: PDF test stalled because "Bill From :" section (still missing) prevented accessing Generate PDF flow.
Email distribution test failed to find “Dashboard” header in <header>; got concatenated string instead → likely markup issue.
Multi-export test flagged “Invoice date: Invalid Date” – date parsing bug stops dashboard from loading valid data.

steps.title: Internationalisation – language & currency
details: Language switcher button (“BETA English”) not found/clickable in multiple tests.
Currency selector not present; user therefore cannot change currency.
Date format test stalled at same language switcher failure – cascading blocker.

steps.title: Responsive design
details: Only fully-passed suite: desktop → tablet → mobile resizing worked functionally.
However automated UI review repeatedly flagged mis-alignment, inconsistent spacing, unclear hierarchy across breakpoints.

emotional_arc: Initial confidence (site loads) quickly drops to frustration when core sections like “Bill From / Bill To” never appear. Continued attempts to explore features (templates, signatures, calculations) produce repeated dead-ends, eroding trust. A brief moment of relief occurs when responsive resizing works, but visual polish issues still leave the shopper with low confidence and a sense that the product is unfinished.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Missing or incorrectly-labelled DOM elements (e.g., “Bill From :”, “Bill To :”, template names, signature areas)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Tests – and therefore users – cannot proceed when primary sections are not rendered or are mis-labelled; blocks entire workflow.
next_actions: Audit component rendering logic after initial page load – ensure conditional rendering doesn’t hide first-step sections.
Standardise labels/text against design spec so automation & users see the same copy.
Add automated smoke test in CI to fail build if critical selectors are missing.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Real-time feedback is a core value prop; when edits don’t show up, users doubt data accuracy.
next_actions: Throttle state updates less aggressively or add debounce; verify two-way binding between form state and preview component.
Add visual loading indicator or toast when preview is out-of-sync.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Repeated ‘looks off’ flags indicate low visual polish, reducing perceived quality and trust.
next_actions: Adopt a design-system spacing scale; run layout regression tests at each breakpoint.
Ensure flex/grid containers align items baseline for labels & inputs.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent styles feel unprofessional and hinder discoverability of actions like ‘Generate PDF’.
next_actions: Centralise button component with size/colour variants in UI library.
Review global typography tokens for headings, subtitles, body; enforce via linter.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Data validation defaults (e.g., “Invoice date: Invalid Date”)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Seeing ‘Invalid Date’ immediately undermines confidence in calculations & exports.
next_actions: Set sane defaults on new invoice creation (today’s date).
Add front-end date validation before rendering; show placeholder only after user input.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Discoverability of advanced actions (logo upload, currency, language)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Hidden or absent controls block international users and brand customisation.
next_actions: Place ‘Language / Currency’ in persistent header dropdown with clear icon.
Add ‘Upload logo’ CTA inside template preview with hover state.
Provide empty-state hint text guiding user.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Many failures are 5 s timeouts; if components load slowly, users need feedback.
next_actions: Lazy-load heavy modules but show skeleton loaders.
Measure TTI for wizard step 1; optimise bundle splitting.

first_tackles.description: Ensure “Step 1 – From & To” sections render immediately with correct h4 text; fixes ~40 % of blocked flows.
Add language/currency dropdown component to header and verify selectors; unlocks all i18n tests.
Patch real-time preview binding so edits propagate without refresh; restores core UX promise.
Implement design-system spacing & label alignment rules; quick CSS pass will remove majority of ‘looks off’ UI flags.
Default invoice metadata (date, number) to valid values to eliminate ‘Invalid Date’ errors seen in export and dashboard.
